title: 110_s3426
content: The Act titled "Foreign Service Overseas Pay Equity Act of 2008" introduces an Overseas Comparability Pay Adjustment under Chapter 4 of the Foreign Service Act of 1980. The Foreign Service Overseas Pay Equity Act of 2008 introduces an Overseas Comparability Pay Adjustment for members of the Service stationed outside the continental United States or a nonforeign area. This adjustment aligns their locality-based comparability payment with what they would receive if stationed in the District of Columbia, and treats it as part of their basic pay for specific purposes. The Foreign Service Overseas Pay Equity Act of 2008 introduces a locality-based comparability payment adjustment for members of the Service stationed outside the continental United States or a nonforeign area. This adjustment is 33.33 percent of the payment applicable under subsection (a) during a specific period in fiscal year 2009. The Foreign Service Overseas Pay Equity Act of 2008 introduces a locality-based comparability payment adjustment for members stationed outside the continental United States or a nonforeign area. The adjustment is 66.67 percent in fiscal year 2010 and 100 percent in fiscal year 2011. A nonforeign area is defined as listed in section 591.205 of title 5, Code of Federal Regulations. The Foreign Service Overseas Pay Equity Act of 2008 introduces a locality-based comparability payment adjustment for members stationed outside the continental United States or a nonforeign area. The adjustment is 66.67 percent in fiscal year 2010 and 100 percent in fiscal year 2011. Additionally, there are conforming amendments relating to the Foreign Service Retirement Systems, including changes to contributions to the fund. The Foreign Service Overseas Pay Equity Act of 2008 introduces a locality-based comparability payment adjustment for members stationed outside the continental United States or a nonforeign area. The adjustment is 66.67 percent in fiscal year 2010 and 100 percent in fiscal year 2011. Amendments are made to the Foreign Service Retirement Systems, including changes to contributions to the fund. Amendments to the computation of annuities under the Foreign Service Act of 1980 will take effect on the first day of the first pay period beginning on or after October 1, 2010. The Foreign Service Act of 1980 is amended to adjust annuity entitlement for members stationed outside the continental United States from December 29, 2002, to the day before the first pay period starting on or after October 1, 2010. The Foreign Service Act of 1980 is amended to adjust annuity entitlement for members stationed outside the continental United States from December 29, 2002, to the day before the first pay period starting on or after October 1, 2010. Deductions and withholdings from pay are also modified accordingly. The Foreign Service Act of 1980 was amended to adjust annuity entitlement percentages for different time periods, ranging from before January 1, 1999, to after October 1, 2010. The Secretary of State must report to specific committees by October 1, 2010, on allowances for Foreign Service members and how they are impacted by amendments to the Foreign Service Act of 1980. The Foreign Service Act of 1980 is amended to adjust the death gratuity for employees. The gratuity amount is based on the employee's salary level at the time of death, with additional considerations for those under a local compensation plan.
